hub_skill_references.hub_description: Create/edit/delete a single issue, view/show issue details
Change status, assign, resolve, manage versions/components
Manage sprints, epics, subtasks, story points
Link issues, view dependencies, blocker chains
Log time, manage worklogs, time reports
Handle service desk requests, SLAs, queues
Git branch names, commits, PR descriptions

actual_skills.name: jira-administration
actual_skills.description: Complete JIRA project and system administration including projects, automation rules, permissions, users, notifications, screens, issue types, and workflows. Use when managing project structure, automating work, configuring team access, or setting up issue tracking.

actual_skills.name: jira-agile-management
actual_skills.description: Epic, sprint, and backlog management - create/link epics, manage sprints, estimate with story points, rank backlog issues.

actual_skills.name: jira-bulk-operations
actual_skills.description: Bulk operations for 50+ issues - transitions, assignments, priorities, cloning, and deletion. Use when: updating multiple issues simultaneously (dry-run preview included), needing rollback safety, or coordinating team changes. Handles partial failures gracefully.

actual_skills.name: jira-collaboration
actual_skills.description: Collaborate on issues: add/edit comments, share attachments, notify users, track activity. For team communication and coordination on JIRA issues.

actual_skills.name: jira-developer-integration
actual_skills.description: Developer workflow integration for JIRA - Git branch names, commit parsing, PR descriptions. Use when generating branch names from issues, linking commits, or creating PR descriptions. Also use to troubleshoot Development Panel issues or automate CI/CD integration.

actual_skills.name: jira-custom-fields
actual_skills.description: Custom field management and configuration - list fields, check project fields, configure Agile fields. Use when discovering custom fields, checking Agile field availability, or configuring project fields.

actual_skills.name: jira-issue-management
actual_skills.description: JIRA issue operations: create, read, update, delete. ALWAYS use this skill when user wants to: (1) create new bugs/tasks/stories, (2) show/view/display/get/see/retrieve/check issue details or information, (3) look up issues, (4) update issue fields, (5) delete issues. Especially trigger when user says 'show me', 'get', 'view', 'details of', 'look at', or references 'the bug/issue/task we just created'.

actual_skills.name: jira-service-management
actual_skills.description: Complete ITSM/ITIL workflow support for JSM - service desks, requests, SLAs, customers, approvals, knowledge base. Use when managing service desk requests, tracking SLAs, or handling customer operations.

actual_skills.name: jira-lifecycle-management
actual_skills.description: Manage issue lifecycle through workflow transitions and status changes. Control who does what and when via assignments, versions, and components.

actual_skills.name: jira-operations
actual_skills.description: Cache management, request batching, and operational utilities. Use when optimizing performance, managing cache, or diagnosing JIRA API issues.

actual_skills.name: jira-issue-relationships
actual_skills.description: Issue linking and dependency management - create links, view blockers, analyze dependencies, clone issues. Use when linking issues, finding blocker chains, or cloning with relationships.

actual_skills.name: jira-search-jql
actual_skills.description: Find issues by criteria (status, assignee, priority, etc.) using JQL. Create filters, export results to CSV/JSON, bulk update. Ideal for reporting and automation.

actual_skills.name: jira-time-tracking
actual_skills.description: Time tracking and worklog management with estimation, reporting, and billing integration. Use for logging work, managing estimates, generating reports, bulk operations, and team time tracking policies.

findings.description: Hub keywords miss several capabilities documented in jira-admin SKILL.md including: users, groups, notifications, screens, issue types, workflows, project categories. Hub only mentions 'permissions', 'project settings', 'automation', 'automation rule'.
findings.recommendation: Expand hub routing keywords for jira-admin to include: 'users', 'groups', 'notification scheme', 'screens', 'issue types', 'workflows', 'workflow scheme', 'project category' to improve routing accuracy for admin operations.

findings.description: Hub description says 'Update 10+ issues at once' but jira-bulk SKILL.md clearly states 'Bulk operations for 50+ issues'. The hub uses a lower threshold (10+) while the skill targets 50+ issues. Scale guidance in bulk skill says: 5-10 issues run directly, 50-100 use dry-run first, 500+ use batching.
findings.recommendation: Update hub description from '10+ issues' to align with bulk skill guidance. Consider: 'Bulk operations on many issues (50+) with dry-run preview' or clarify that 10+ is the threshold where bulk MIGHT be considered, while 50+ is the primary use case.

findings.description: Hub description 'Find custom field IDs' is too narrow. jira-fields SKILL.md description covers: 'Custom field management and configuration - list fields, check project fields, configure Agile fields'. The skill does much more than just finding field IDs.
findings.recommendation: Update hub description to: 'Custom field discovery and Agile field configuration' or 'Find field IDs, check project fields, configure Agile fields'.

findings.description: Hub keywords include 'watch' but actual skill has 'watchers' and also mentions 'notifications' and 'activity history' which are not in hub routing keywords. The skill YAML frontmatter explicitly lists keywords: comments, attachments, notifications, watchers, activity history.
findings.recommendation: Add 'notify', 'notification', 'activity', 'history', 'changelog' to hub routing keywords for jira-collaborate.

findings.description: Hub description mentions 'queues' and 'approval', 'knowledge base', 'asset' but the Quick Reference table row only shows 'Handle service desk requests, SLAs, queues'. The routing keywords section correctly includes all terms but the Quick Reference table is incomplete.
findings.recommendation: Update Quick Reference table description to: 'Handle service desk requests, SLAs, queues, approvals, assets, knowledge base' to match the routing keywords section.

findings.description: Hub Quick Reference says 'Project discovery, cache management, diagnostics' but hub routing keywords only include 'cache', 'warm cache', 'project discovery'. Missing 'diagnostics' keyword and the skill also covers 'request batching' and 'performance optimization'.
findings.recommendation: Add 'diagnostics', 'performance', 'request batching', 'cache status', 'cache clear' to hub routing keywords for jira-ops.

findings.description: Hub description says 'manage versions/components' but the routing keywords section only includes 'transition', 'move to', 'assign', 'close'. No keywords for versions or components routing despite the Quick Reference mentioning them.
findings.recommendation: Add 'version', 'release', 'component', 'resolve', 'reopen', 'archive' to hub routing keywords for jira-lifecycle.

notes: All 13 skills referenced in the hub exist as actual skill directories - no MISSING_SKILL_REF or WRONG_SKILL_NAME issues found.
All actual skills are routed from the hub - no UNROUTED_SKILL issues found.
The frontmatter description in jira-assistant states '13 specialized skills' which matches the actual count.
Several findings relate to hub routing keywords being less comprehensive than the actual skill capabilities.
The Negative Triggers table in the hub provides good disambiguation guidance for all skills.
